I was watching this stream, but instead of getting scared, I fell asleep...
Rushia-hime, definitively you always search more adrenaline.
Also at beginning of stream... Your voice was sounding like different.

author: Cnouki
text: Poor Rushia. She's just bad at this game. Her reaction time is really slow and she don't use the map effectively. Probably not for her.

author: RevilloPhoenix
text: Nor is she able to tell sound direction well so ran into a number of obvious ones you could hear.

author: tigerhawk84
text: @RevilloPhoenix  I've found most of them couldn't tell the audio direction that well at first. Its probably because they have monitors in their ears so they can hear their own voice/monitor the mic output, and then a set of over-ear headphones ontop of that to hear the actual game audio. This can really screw with your directional sound-sense, but is fairly common with most professional streamers.

author: RevilloPhoenix
text: I'm pretty sure they don't listen to their own voice, it's super hard to talk while hearing yourself and it's also evident by stuff like them not noticing if they are muted till chat says so and asking chat about sound level being good or no. Some of them reacted really well to sound thou, Rushi is doing noticeably worse than most in terms of sound.

author: tigerhawk84
text: @RevilloPhoenix  Guess she just sucks then? Oh well. She is here to have fun and entertain her audience, not be esports lol.

author: Cnouki
text: I think either they're too focused on talking with chat or they don't use headset (probably this).

author: RevilloPhoenix
text: @tigerhawk84  Ya, she's still adorable~

author: Kito
text:
@RevilloPhoenix  Yeah, I think she sometimes wears her headphones the wrong way lol
She did that in her apex stream with matsuri and couldn't tell what direction she was being shot from
